Sample.Title: Angular Single-Page Application (SPA) calling .NET Core Web API using App Roles and Security Groups for Implementing Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)

AppRoles.Name: TenantAdmin
AppRoles.Description: Admins can read any user's todolist

AppRoles.Name: TenantUser
AppRoles.Description: Users can read and modify their todolists

ManualSteps.Comment: You can run the ..\CreateUsersAndAssignRoles.ps1 command to automatically create a number of users, and assign users to these roles or assign users to this application app roles using the portal.To receive the `roles` claim with the name of the app roles this user is assigned to, make sure that the user accounts you plan to sign-in to this app is assigned to the app roles of this app. The guide, https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/manage-apps/assign-user-or-group-access-portal#assign-a-user-to-an-app---portal provides step by step instructions.

ManualSteps.Comment: You can run the ..\CreateUsersAndAssignRoles.ps1 command to automatically create a number of users, and assign users to these roles or assign users to this application app roles using the portal.To receive the `roles` claim with the name of the app roles this user is assigned to, make sure that the user accounts you plan to sign-in to this app is assigned to the app roles of this app. The guide, https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/manage-apps/assign-user-or-group-access-portal#assign-a-user-to-an-app---portal provides step by step instructions.

Mappings.key: Enter the domain of your Azure AD tenant, e.g. 'contoso.onmicrosoft.com'
Enter the Id of your Azure AD tenant copied from the Azure portal
Enter the application ID (clientId) of the 'TodoListAPI' application copied from the Azure portal
Enter the TodoList Web APIs base address, e.g. 'https://localhost:44351/api/todolist'
Enter the API scopes as declared in the app registration 'Expose an Api' blade in the form of 'api://{clientId}/access_as_user'
